The Bradford Distribution .A Leimkuhler, Ferdinand F. The distribution of references in a collection of pertinent source documents can be described and predicted by the relation F(x) = ln(1 + bx)/ln(1 + b) where the parameter b is related to the subject field and the completeness of the collection.. The model is used to predict the reference yield of abstracting journals in a search for thermophysical property data.. It is used also to explain differences among various literature studies of the past in terms of differences in subject and comprehensiveness of search.. The model is derived from S.C. Bradford's 'law of scattering' and is called the Bradford Distribution.. .X 19	1	778 31	2	778 33	1	778 36	2	778 37	1	778 39	1	778 40	1	778 41	1	778 43	1	778 44	2	778 46	2	778 47	2	778 50	1	778 55	2	778 57	2	778 62	3	778 65	1	778 75	1	778 76	1	778 81	1	778 88	1	778 97	1	778 102	1	778 103	1	778 162	1	778 181	1	778 182	1	778 183	1	778 184	2	778 193	2	778 195	2	778 198	1	778 201	2	778 203	1	778 204	1	778 205	1	778 233	3	778 253	1	778 267	2	778 269	1	778 313	1	778 314	1	778 359	12	778 377	1	778 379	4	778 382	1	778 395	3	778 415	1	778 416	2	778 505	3	778 515	1	778 560	1	778 573	4	778 586	1	778 587	2	778 614	1	778 616	1	778 618	1	778 632	1	778 635	1	778 638	1	778 651	1	778 667	2	778 748	13	778 749	1	778 750	1	778 751	9	778 759	4	778 760	1	778 764	1	778 765	12	778 767	3	778 774	1	778 777	1	778 778	26	778 782	1	778 786	1	778 787	3	778 791	8	778 792	1	778 793	2	778 800	3	778 804	2	778 805	1	778 811	1	778 889	2	778 891	1	778 893	4	778 905	1	778 925	3	778 948	1	778 952	2	778 953	1	778 958	1	778 961	1	778 964	1	778 968	1	778 983	1	778 1009	1	778 1016	4	778 1018	1	778 1019	2	778 1061	1	778 1081	2	778 1082	2	778 1083	6	778 1084	1	778 1085	7	778 1086	6	778 1087	1	778 1090	1	778 1114	1	778 1122	1	778 1173	2	778 1182	6	778 1200	1	778 1201	4	778 1226	1	778 1240	1	778 1274	2	778 1277	1	778 1278	2	778 1280	1	778 1285	1	778 1287	1	778 1301	1	778 1302	1	778 1304	1	778 1313	1	778 1338	1	778 1344	1	778 1347	1	778 1359	1	778 1380	1	778 1397	1	778 1401	1	778 1417	2	778 1418	3	778 1428	1	778 1444	1	778 1451	1	778 1451	1	778
